pr_title: ISPN-11435 The server sometimes doesn't start all the caches

timeline.message:
ISPN-11435 DefaultCacheManager should start all defined caches

HotRodServer tries to pre-start all defined caches,
but this should happen everywhere, not just in the server.

Applications/tests that want to start caches individually
can use the DefaultCacheManager constructors with a start
parameter.

timeline.bodyText: This comment is no longer valid since you've moved things around
timeline.author: tristantarrant

replies.bodyText: True. I'm changing the listener to include the current state and I'm removing the explicit iteration.
replies.author: danberindei

timeline.bodyText: Why are you not starting the static caches before the persisted ones ?
timeline.author: tristantarrant

replies.bodyText: It was a shortcut to avoid starting a cache with an incompatible configuration, since we already check compatibility for caches from local persistent state. But I'm now convinced that I need to replicate the compatibility check for statically defined caches anyway.
replies.author: danberindei

ISPN-11435 DefaultCacheManager should start all defined caches

HotRodServer tries to pre-start all defined caches,
but this should happen everywhere, not just in the server.

Caches are started on a single thread, to avoid overloading
the blocking thread pool.

Applications/tests that want to start caches individually
have to define the caches after starting the DefaultCacheManager.
